treevalues 0.1.0
  • Reference
  • Articles
    • Tutorial: using ``treevalues`` to perform inference on ``rpart`` trees

Reference

All functions

TNSurv()

Survival function of truncated normal distribution. This comes directly from the Outference Package. The code and the documentation can be found at https://github.com/shuxiaoc/outference.

blsdata blsdata

Dataset from the Box Lunch Study, taken from the "visTree" package.

branchInference()

This is the main function for carrying out inference on an ``rpart`` regression tree. This function can be used to carry out the "inference on a pair of sibling regions" or the "efficient alternative inference on a single region" described in our paper.

correctPVal()

Get a pvalue for a selective Z-test.

finiteE()

Make endpoints of intervals finite

getAllBranches()

This function takes an rpart tree and

getAnc()

Returns vector of ancestors in ``tree`` for node ``nn``.

getBranch()

Pass in an rpart tree and also a node number. The nodes are numbered strangely in rpart. If no node numbers are passed in, a list of all branches in the tree will be returned. Pass in a tree and a node number (node number like the type that comes up in rpart.plot!!!)

getDesc()

Returns vector of descendents in ``tree`` for node ``nn``.

getInterval()

Workhorse function for computing conditioning sets.

getRegion()

Pass in a tree and a node number (node number like the type that comes up in rpart.plot!!!)

inferenceFrame()

This function can optionally be used prior to running ``treeval.plot`` to make ``treeval.plot`` run more efficiently.

magicfun()

A helper function for approximating normal tail probabilities This comes directly from the Outference Package. The code and the documentation can be found at https://github.com/shuxiaoc/outference.

treeval.plot()

This function allows users to plot their rpart object with all splits labeled with p-values and all nodes labeled with confidence intervals.
